data.text: A clear, colorless, odorless, and tasteless liquid, H<sub>2</sub>O, essential for most plant and animal life and the most widely used of all solvents. Freezing point 0°C (32°F); boiling point 100°C (212°F); specific gravity (4°C) 1.0000; weight per gallon (15°C) 8.338 pounds (3.782 kilograms).
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Any of various forms of water.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Naturally occurring mineral water, as at a spa.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A body of water such as a sea, lake, river, or stream.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A particular stretch of sea or ocean, especially that of a state or country.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
